meanings.definition: To cause (an image) to break up into pixels.
meanings.sent1: The old TV was pixelating, making it hard to see the characters clearly.
meanings.sent2: When the video started pixelating, I knew there was a problem with the internet connection.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur looked like it was pixelating, creating a funny mosaic effect.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of that day were pixelating, fading into small, fragmented moments.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were pixelating the canvas, transforming it into a digital masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The image on the screen began pixelating, losing its sharpness.
meanings.sent2: As the video streamed, the quality started pixelating, causing distortion.
meanings.sent3: The colors in the painting seemed to be pixelating, creating a unique and abstract look.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were pixelating, becoming unclear and fragmented.
meanings.sent5: The landscape outside the window was pixelating, as if viewed through a digital filter.

meanings.definition: The process of converting an image into pixels.
meanings.sent1: The pixelating of the photograph was done carefully to maintain quality.
meanings.sent2: During the pixelating of the image, each detail was analyzed and transformed.
meanings.sent3: The pixelating of the logo was a meticulous task, ensuring every pixel was in place.
meanings.sent4: In the world of digital art, pixelating is a crucial step in creating realistic images.
meanings.sent5: The pixelating of the graphic was so precise that every pixel seemed to come alive on the screen.
